title: Justtoons
author: Justtoons
content: I am writing to bring attention to a significant issue that many members, especially beginners and myself are facing when browsing older threads. It has come to my attention that several images uploaded using imgur are currently displaying errors making it difficult for newcomers to understand the content and context of those threads.As a beginner, I have always relied on studying old posts to gain knowledge and insights about various aspects of cryptocurrencies. However, with the disappearance of these images, the threads become incomplete and challenging to comprehend fully. With the help of the script written by @tryninja, users can update all their previous threads. Thanks to joker_josue for the creation of the new Bitcointalk image url web we are glad to have you here in a time of need.I kindly request the assistance members in addressing this issue. It would be greatly appreciated if some users  put in effort  to restore or replace the broken images ensuring that valuable information is accessible to all members including junior members  like myself and newcomers.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: Based on theymos replies, it seems nothing will change.Quote from: theymos on May 12, 2023, 12:41:48 AMI think that what it is is that imgur added a new very restrictive per-IP limit on image downloads. So all ip.bitcointalk.org requests are blocked, but even many Tor exit nodes are being blocked, for example.I'm not going to attempt to play some cat-and-mouse game with imgur, so people will just have to use a different service such as TalkImg.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Let me quote my old reply regarding same issue sometimes this week.QuoteThe issue I noticed it about a week ago, and a lot of forum members have been complaining about it here on the forum, and a user has also created a thread regarding the issue.  Imgur images suddenly became invalid.There have also been alternative suggestions to the imgur issue, and joker_josue created a specific design for Bitcointalk users to avoid this kind of imgur issue in the future .  TalkImg.com: Image Hosting for BitcoinTalk Today, a new progress was also launched by TryNinja . [Script] Imgur to TalkImg: automatically fix your broken imagesThe issue of Imgur is no longer something new here on the forum, and very soon all those whose post images are affected will have them fixed up again, and those old posts will go back to normal again.

comments.author: God Of Thunder
comments.body: Quote from: Justtoons on May 16, 2023, 01:30:24 PMI kindly request the assistance members in addressing this issue. It would be greatly appreciated if some users  put in effort  to restore or replace the broken images ensuring that valuable information is accessible to all members including junior members  like myself and newcomers. I thought you are too new not to notice and not to know what was going on. Well, It seems you already know everything. You know why the images are not showing anymore and you know TryNinja and Joker_josue working on it with their website and script. So, what other assistance do you expect from members addressing this issue? Whoever is active in the forum already knows that images on their thread are not showing anymore. They are already using some of the methods TryNinja and LoyceV bring to recover the images. About old threads, Only thread creators and Moderators have access to edit their posts. Moderators are unlikely to edit those posts to replace the images. It's not their job. If the thread creator changes the image link, that's the only way those images can be back. LoyceV downloads around 800K images. Currently, he working on Zip those images by username. If anyone wants to fix the images of their thread, they can knock LoyceV if they want or use the method of TryNinja.

The forum contains some repetition of topics but not so much that it is noticeable.  Some users, particularly newbies, might not necessarily want to know whether a topic already exists or not before starting a new one they believe they have an idea for or want others to pay attention to. Some people don't know how to utilize the search option or don't see the need to learn about it, resulting in the forum's posts being repeated.
